page.title: 02Bayford Area-Past/Present
page.content: {Past} Local village names are mainly {Anglo-Saxon in origin,}and Bayford was 'Begesford.' It means 'Beah's Ford.' L'Berkhamsted was 'Beorhamstede,' meaning 'Homestead on the hill.' Both Parishes were named in the {Domesday Survey,}1086. William I held Bayford in Hertford Hundred, King Edward held it at his death. {Present } As with many villages today there is a{declining population.}The 1971 Census showed Bayford's population as 481, it was 414 in 1981 a 13.93% decrease. L' Berkhamsted's 1971 population was 546, and 469 in 1981. There is only Bayford J.M.I. School. {Only 25 children}now attend, less next year. Secondary children mainly attend schools in Hertford and Brookmans Park.
